title: Manchester City enjoy Abu Dhabi training camp | Daily Mail Online
text: comments While the rest of the United Kingdom battened down the hatches in preparation for Storm Doris, the stars of Manchester City were enjoying some of the finest weather on offer in Abu Dhabi. The Citizens saw their derby game against Manchester United postponed due to their EFL Cup final commitments and Pep Guardiola saw the perfect opportunity to whisk his team away for a warm weather break. But the whistle-stop trip was never going to be a holiday for Sergio Aguero and Co as Guardiola put his stars through their paces at the Emirates Palace Training Complex on Wednesday. Manchester City train with Abu Dhabi's famous skyscrapers dominating the background Pep Guardiola took his first-team squad through a session at the Emirates Palace Complex Sergio Aguero and Raheem Sterling undergo some routine stretches as they warm up Set in front of a stunning backdrop of skyscrapers and blue skies, the Emirates Palace Training Complex is a FIFA standard camp designed for professional football teams seeking warmer climes through harsh winters. The facility includes a meeting room with LCD TV screen so Guardiola can run through his tactical analysis, an outdoor terrace so stars can top up their tans and a spa, fully equipped with a jacuzzi, sauna, steam room and massage rooms.
